channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Appeals court bars Trump from deploying National Guard in Illinois
item.description: The appeals court weighed in after a federal judge, concluding that it was “likely to lead to civil unrest,” barred the president from deploying troop...

item.title: Trump and Zelensky discuss Tomahawk missiles for Ukraine, sources say
item.description: President Trump spoke Saturday with Ukrainian President Volodymr Zelensky and they discussed the possibility of Ukraine obtaining Tomahawk long-range ...

item.title: Trump demands Defense secretary "get our Troops PAID" amid government shutdown
item.description: President Trump has issued the Defense secretary a directive to find funding to pay U.S. troops, given dollars earmarked to do so are set to run out o...

item.title: Trump's second checkup describes "exceptional health"
item.description: President Trump's second "routine yearly checkup" on Friday determined that he is in "exceptional health." The big picture: Trump has downplayed conce...

item.title: AI drones are America's newest cops
item.description: Police and sheriff's departments across America are using AI-powered drones for pursuits, investigations and emergencies — even delivering Narcan to s...

item.title: How to measure the economy when the government isn't doing it
item.description: Everything's an economic indicator these days — from offbeat numbers on restaurant reservations and visits to the Statue of Liberty to more standard i...

item.title: More than 1,000 CDC staff receive layoff notices during government shutdown
item.description: Another round of mass layoffs has struck CDC. The agency had already been cut during a reorganization this year, and more employees are now being shed...

item.title: Trump is in ‘excellent’ health, White House says, amid questions about second exam
item.description: Outside physicians asked why the president was making a return trip to Walter Reed National Military Medical Center, six months after undergoing medic...

item.title: The ‘least intensity’ shutdown ever and why it could go on longer
item.description: Veterans of shutdowns of the past 30 years say there’s little passion, among lawmakers and constituents, over this shutdown.

item.title: Trump orders Defense Dept. to issue military paychecks during shutdown
item.description: Trump said that the Pentagon would repurpose money to make payroll, as military service members were poised to miss paychecks on Wednesday. Most other...

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
